Verifying the accuracy of invoices, evaluating the cost effectiveness of accounts, identifying unnecessary minimum billing charges, and uncovering redundant billing charges offers you the opportunity to see holes in your budget where your dollars could be leaking.


Additionally P3 Cost Analysts endeavors, on your company’s behalf, to correct any billing errors uncovered during the utility audit process, and obtain a refund/credit for the full amount of the overcharge (within the statute of limitations). And because we deal directly with the proper utility departments, we cut through the “red tape” to get available refunds quickly.


Read The WhitepaperDownload The Whitepaper


When businesses ﬁrst consider ways to cut utility costs, they typically think in terms of reducing usage. From installing energy efficient light bulbs and switches to lowering water consumption, these tactics are often the only thoughts that come to mind. And though reducing usage is a good practice, businesses are missing many savings opportunities on utilities by assuming that utilities costs themselves are largely ﬁxed.


With the utility industry being highly regulated, it’s easy to see why many companies fall under the ﬁxed cost assumption. Because utility tariffs and fees are so complex, unless you have a utility expert looking under the hood of your utility statements and actually knowing what to look for, there are many errors and overcharges that will go unnoticed.


To see any real change in utility savings, a deep audit of your records and statements is a necessity. Some may think they have people in-house that are already monitoring for errors, but the fact is, utility cost auditing requires specialty training that is never their core competency.


In this white paper, we will outline how the utility industry functions, explore the types of errors and overcharges that go unnoticed, reveal how our experts at P3 Cost Analysts work through an auditing process, and share some examples of tangible savings we discover for clients.


 


Most businesses may know whether or not they operate in a regulated or deregulated energy market. If their energy provider has a government granted monopoly in the state or region, then they’re in a regulated market. If multiple providers compete to be their energy provider, they’re in a deregulated market. The type of market a business functions in depends on the state in which they’re located, with the majority of states operating in a regulated market.


In regulated markets, the utility provider is a single entity that handles the entire supply chain of energy. In deregulated markets, on the other hand, while there may still be one main energy provider, they can sell energy to multiple third parties, who set their own rates and become the energy suppliers for the business. In either regulated or deregulated markets, it’s always up to the consumer, not the vendor, to ﬁnd savings.


Energy Tariffs apply to both regulated and deregulated markets and dictate how much energy suppliers charge customers based on their type of industry, usage, time of usage, and many other factors outlined in lengthy and complex documents.


It’s highly difficult (if not impossible) for non-experts to understand how these tariffs are billed because there are so many provisions, and they’re written for the utility company, not for the customer to understand. You can click here to try and calculate a simple electric bill. You also automatically get billed for all tariffs riders unless you take action to opt out. And even when you do take action to opt out, the utility company might tell you that you’ll lose other beneﬁts if you do not implement changes correctly.


For example:


A manufacturing company may qualify for a lower tier of billing if 40% of their energy usage comes from natural gas. However, this incentive only applies if the business is using that natural gas at certain times of the day. As such, if the business isn’t aware of the incentive or doesn’t have the right tracking systems in place to take advantage of the incentive, they may miss out on savings.


 


All of the errors found in the billing process are based on algorithms, numbers, improper calculations, and impossibilities. With our expertise, we understand what the utility companies are liable for in regards to errors. This allows us to determine whether refunds are applicable or not and to prove to the utility company how a certain error occurred within their own regulations.


Hours used can be deﬁned as the number of hours you used your electricity based on your peak demand.


For example:


If a company uses 50,000 kWh and has a peak demand of 100kW, the hours used is 500 (50,000/100 = 500). In a 30-day bill cycle, there is a maximum of 720 hours (24 hours x 30 days). If the hours used in a 30-day bill cycle computes 750 hours, it simply is an impossibility, and we know there is an error.


This efficiency percentage can never be greater than 100%. Thus, if the load factor calculation the utility company presents is over 100%, there is a clear error.


Utility companies are allowed to estimate bills based on the history of the business’ electrical usage, but that estimate can be wrong upon closer inspection of the records. One area we look at is estimated demands. “Demand” is the highest amount of energy, measured in kilowatts of kilovolts, that a company uses over a short period of time. Many electric meters require the demand to be reset to zero after each meter read.


For example:


If the estimated demand is 100 kW, but the previous actual meter read was 90 kW and the next actual read was 70 kW, we know it’s impossible for the demand to be 100 kW this time because they must not have reset the meter after the previous reading.


A demand ratchet is the percentage of your peak demand that you have to pay each month even if you don’t use that energy. We look for times when the demand reading might trigger a demand ratchet or other multipliers that bring the client into a higher tier for kilowatt charges and make the necessary changes to fall under the correct tier. Without these ﬁxes, a client could stay in the wrong pricing tier for up to 12 months, leading to many extra charges.


These percentages vary, and if you do not understand them, you can fall into a higher ratchet than you need to be.


For example:


A company is currently paying 100% of their demand ratchet. But since they heat their buildings with 100% electricity instead of gas, their tari. allows them to pay a 50% demand ratchet. Until this gets noticed, they will be wasting a lot of money that they don’t need to.


In most water billing errors, there’s an issue with how a company is being billed for their sewage. Sewage billing is based on a percentage of water consumption, which in many states is 100%. Some companies, however, are billed at 100% of water consumption when in fact not all of their water is going into sewage.


For example:


Breweries use large quantities of water to brew their beer, but that water isn’t going back into sewage - it’s going out into the tap room and out the door in cans. Thus, they shouldn’t be charged 100% for sewage based on how they use their water.


Many municipalities use computers to read the meters. If the data is not entered into the computer correctly on the front end, or if the computer simply makes an error, overcharges can occur.


For example:


We went to work for one client and noticed the water meter was being read correctly. However, due to an error in the software, the sewer usage was being calculated at a rate of 10x. Thus, while the fees and readings themselves were accurate, the usage calculation was not. This resulted in a 10x overcharge on the client’s sewer fees.


Most of the errors with gas involve the utility company not billing based on the contractual terms. A customer will enter into a contract with a utility company, but the utility company won’t act according to the contractual terms.


With some tariffs and regions, the tariffs are set to change automatically. This means that if usage falls or increases, a customer may be moved or ‘defaulted’ into a lower or higher tariffs bracket. Generally, this will result in the most cost-effective rate for the customer. However, these automatic changes routinely fail to occur. Only through a deep analysis of historical usage can a customer determine if an error has occurred.


For example:


We had one client who had four different natural gas accounts. Two of them were billed on the General Large tariffs and two of them were billed on the General Small tariffs. The usage, however, indicated that all four accounts should have been billed on the General Small tariffs.


The vendor initially fought this claim, as they did not want to issue a refund for the mistake or reduce their revenue. However, after escalating the claim up to the vendor’s senior management, we were able to recover the overcharge.


 


When you consider the complexity of tariffs and the numerous errors that can occur in the utility billing process, it makes sense to do a deep audit and reap the savings of doing so. With the P3 Utility Auditing solution, you can take advantage of this auditing process risk free. There’s no charge for the hundreds of hours of upfront auditing time by our experts. We simply receive 50% of the


savings we find for a period of 60 months. About 99% of the time, clients allow us to implement what we find because our recommendations make sense and produce real savings.


Note: The process below mostly applies to companies in regulated markets. In deregulated markets, P3 simply acts as an energy broker monitoring the market, knowing the best time to lock in a contract, and receiving a small commission on these arrangements. There are still opportunities to ﬁnd billing errors, but we don’t share in the kilowatt per hour rate reductions like we do in regulated markets.


We schedule a 15-20 minute meeting to explain our shared savings agreement and the materials we need to get started, including copies of invoices and authorization documents.


We work with the client to gain access to 12 - 36 months of invoices, depending on the statute of limitations in their state (often, if we have the vendor online logins, we may only need a single invoice).


Our experts start dissecting invoices and provide the client with weekly or bi-weekly updates on overcharges and errors found. We also deliver these savings as we go instead of waiting until the end of the audit.


This phase can take anywhere from 4-6 weeks to get the initial results for a mid-size client, and then once these ﬁndings are represented to the client, it can take another 4-6 weeks to get those savings implemented, depending on which part of the billing cycle we step in.


After the initial audit, we move into the ongoing auditing phase where we monitor invoices every month and make sure errors don’t continue to appear and that the savings are intact.


 


In some cases, clients have been in business for decades and think that what they’re doing “works” and they don’t need to change anything. Some may also look at the P3 Utility Auditing solution as “too good to be true,” leading to general skepticism about the offering.


Others believe the people they have in-house monitoring utility charges are sufficient. The controller or accounts payable department is typically the one in charge of managing this, but this area is never anyone’s core competency. While these people have hundreds of other things on their plates, they may worry about us making them look bad when we ﬁnd many savings that went unnoticed previously.


In response to these objections, it should be clariﬁed that our sole purpose is to optimize savings, and that the time and expertise involved to audit these correctly is immense. What companies are already doing may work to an extent, but we have the expertise to take savings to the next level. We provide a valuable service that supplements and supports our clients moving forward. It’s a win-win relationship that has proven results.


Through this analysis, it has become clear that achieving real savings on utilities is complex. Between all the nuances with tariffs and billing, it’s difﬁcult for customers to ﬁnd these savings on their own. Luckily, with the help of utility auditing experts, a number of errors can be discovered through a detailed audit leading to many savings. And the best part of this process is that it’s risk free, with no upfront charges and only savings.


If you’re interested in having P3 Cost Analysts take a look at your utility bills and see what our auditors can uncover, reach out to us on our website, by filling out our contact form, or calling 1-877-843-7579, and we’ll be in touch.


Helping over 30,000 client locations save money on their monthly expenses since 1991.


P3 Cost Analysts is proud to be a fully remote working organization since 2021. 100% of P3 employees work remotely.


© 2022 P3 Cost Analysts, All rights reserved.


The global market for Telecom Managed Services is expected to reach US$26.2 billion by 2025. Such a remarkable forecast reveals the undeniable value and escalating demand for these services in modern business. In an era where technology is not only everywhere but constantly evolving, the need for expertly managed communications services becomes even more apparent.


So, what exactly are telecommunications managed services? Their definition and scope are ever-changing. This article offers a comprehensive look into the various components of managed telecom services. We’ll break down their functionalities, the key benefits they offer, and the alternative approaches businesses might consider.


Keep reading to explore the role these services play in the modern business landscape.


Managed Telecom Services involve outsourcing the management and maintenance of an organization’s telecommunications infrastructure to a third-party provider. The primary objective is to let businesses concentrate on their core competencies, ensuring their telecommunications requirements are in the hands of seasoned professionals.


Given the astonishing rate at which technology is advancing today, the role of an in-house IT department is intensifying. Keeping up with daily technological advancements is not just challenging, but it’s quickly becoming a full-time job in itself. As more and more businesses integrate high-tech solutions into their operations, the demands on the IT department build up.


The quest for secure, reliable, and efficient connections has never been so critical. Now, when almost every business operation hinges on technology, ensuring a highly functioning telecommunications system is crucial. It’s amidst these challenges that businesses increasingly turn to Managed Telecom Services as a solution to streamline, secure, and enhance their communications infrastructure.


In an age where effective communication is the cornerstone of business success, understanding the services offered by telecom management professionals is essential. Let’s dive into the specifics of what telecom managed service providers bring to the table:


Networks form the backbone of modern telecommunications. Managed network services ensure that both voice and data networks operate smoothly, with minimal downtime and optimal performance.


Data drives decisions in the modern business landscape. These services encompass the storage, retrieval, and transmission of data, ensuring businesses have access to critical information when needed.


From traditional phone lines to cutting-edge VoIP and unified communications, managed communication services ensure businesses can communicate internally and externally without any hitches.


Managing mobile devices, apps, and networks is crucial with the rise of remote work and the need for on-the-go connectivity. These services help businesses stay connected, no matter where they are.


Data centers are the heart of many organizations, hosting critical applications and data. These services oversee the infrastructure, ensuring high availability and performance.


In an era of rising cyber threats, securing telecommunication infrastructures is paramount. Managed security services provide continuous monitoring, threat detection, and response measures to safeguard assets.


The hardware that forms the foundation of telecommunications shouldn’t be overlooked. Managed IT equipment services take care of maintaining, updating, and ensuring that devices like routers, switches, servers, and other crucial components operate optimally.


Software drives many of the functions in telecom networks, from routing calls to ensuring data security. Managed software services ensure that all software components are up-to-date, bug-free, and tailored to the organization’s specific needs.


Managed service providers bring a blend of expertise, state-of-the-art tools, and proactive methodologies, offering businesses an edge in a competitive landscape. Here are some of the compelling advantages of this partnership:


By partnering with a managed service provider, organizations can achieve significant cost savings. Instead of sustaining the expenses of an extensive in-house team or constantly updating technology, businesses can leverage the economies of scale provided by these experts.


Managed service providers bring expertise that helps streamline telecom operations. Their proficiency eliminates unnecessary complexities, allowing businesses to function more smoothly and efficiently.


With the technical aspects of IT and telecommunications managed externally, internal staff can center their efforts on the organization’s core objectives. This focus ensures that staff productivity remains high and is unhampered by tech-related distractions.


Outsourcing management means issues like compatibility across cloud applications, performance challenges, and rapid service development are taken care of by the service provider. Organizations can thus remain confident in the reliability and scalability of their tech infrastructure.


Managed service providers offer solutions tailored to the unique requirements and goals of each business. This customization ensures that the technology infrastructure and services align perfectly with the organization’s objectives.


Constant oversight is a hallmark of professionally managed service providers. They not only provide 24/7 monitoring but also offer insights through regular performance tracking, enabling informed strategic decision-making.


There is another side to the coin. Telecom managed service providers come with their own set of expenses. So, what’s the alternative? Cost reduction firms like P3 Cost Analysts specialize in telecom auditing, finding discrepancies in billing, and ensuring businesses only pay for what they use. Here’s what P3 brings to the table:


The P3 model focuses on transparency and saving money rather than additional expenses. For businesses tight on budget or looking for efficiency, P3 provides a compelling alternative.


Take, for instance, a recent case study involving a school system. Despite the client paying optimal rates, P3 identified a billing error that had persisted for years. Upon extensive negotiation, the client was rewarded with a hefty refund check of $150,000 and a monthly bill reduction of over $3,000.


This scenario underscores P3’s diligent commitment to ensuring clients are only billed for what they should be.


In our exploration of Telecom Managed Services, we’ve seen how they present a comprehensive solution for businesses, addressing every aspect of telecommunication needs. These services offer an array of benefits, from streamlining operations to enhancing technological infrastructure.


While these advantages are clear, it’s crucial for organizations to assess their unique needs and financial landscape. Many will find that the financial inspection provided by a telecom audit company, such as P3 Cost Analysts, aligns more seamlessly with their end goals.


With a telecom expense audit at P3 Cost Analysts, we don’t just navigate the convoluted landscape of telephone billing — we master it. We’re your allies in detecting and eliminating redundant charges, assessing your billing structures against current market standards, and securing refunds from billing inaccuracies that negatively impact your financials.


If you’re ready to save 15-30% on telecom overcharges, reach out to one of our experts today.


Helping over 30,000 client locations save money on their monthly expenses since 1991.

In today’s fast-paced world, many families are grappling with the growing pressure that a single income might not be enough to meet their needs. Some stay-at-home moms, often the unsung heroes of multitasking and family management, are proving that they are truly superhuman. They are not only caring for their children but also seeking opportunities to contribute financially while maintaining the delicate balance between work and family life.


Home-based franchises provide a compelling solution, offering these remarkable moms a chance to unleash their entrepreneurial spirit, create flexible schedules, and boost family incomes. So, for you stay-at-home moms out there, whether you have previous experience or not, there’s a franchise that matches your skills and aspirations. We know you’ve got enough on your plate at home, so we’ve gathered some of the best franchises for moms right here! Let’s dive in.


Home-based franchises offer a unique blend of flexibility and work-life balance that perfectly complements the hectic lives of stay-at-home moms. While anyone may appreciate a home-based business opportunity, for mothers, these opportunities represent more than just a source of income. They are a pathway to personal and financial fulfillment that allows them to spend the day at home with their children. Here are some key benefits:


Moms are some of the most amazing humans on the planet. While some may think that the skills they have mastered in motherhood don’t carry over to the business world, that couldn’t be further from the truth.


Moms are known for their multitasking abilities and strong organizational skills, making them ideal candidates for running successful franchises from the comfort of their homes. Here are a few other reasons why moms excel as franchise owners:


P3 Cost Analysts offers an extraordinary franchise opportunity in the field of cost reduction. With over 30 years of industry experience, P3 specializes in helping businesses save money by auditing monthly vendor charges, uncovering hidden savings, and ensuring accurate billing. This unique franchise opportunity allows you to tap into P3’s expertise and join the booming cost reduction industry.


Moms make exceptional franchise owners at P3 Cost Analysts because they bring essential skills to the table. This is one of the best franchises for moms with a knack for business development and a desire to make a positive financial impact on businesses. With no previous auditing experience required, P3 Cost Analysts offers a straightforward path to success. Moms can enjoy the flexibility of owning their franchise while benefiting from comprehensive training and ongoing support.


Caring Transitions provides essential services to older adults and their families during significant life transitions. Their business model goes beyond a single service, focusing on meeting the comprehensive needs of clients during times of change. These transitions may include home relocation, downsizing, and estate sales services. With approximately 75 million seniors in the United States needing these services, Caring Transitions operates in a rapidly growing market. It’s a low-cost, home-based mom franchise that empowers franchisees to contribute positively to their community while building a sustainable business.


This franchise offers an ideal platform for stay-at-home moms to generate income while making a profound impact on their community. The company’s emphasis on flexibility allows moms to manage their own schedules, making it compatible with family life. Moreover, stay-at-home moms, known for their innate compassion, empathy, and caring nature, are exceptionally well-suited to excel as franchise owners with Caring Transitions, making it one of the best franchises for moms.


Tutoring Works offers an appealing tutoring business opportunity with the flexibility to work from home and establish a tutoring company. Founded by parents and educators, Tutoring Works provides comprehensive training, eliminating the need for prior teaching or tutorial experience. The tutoring industry’s stability and increasing demand, especially with the growth of remote learning, make it one of the best franchises for moms, especially those with a background in education.


This opportunity stands out as an ideal option for moms, providing the freedom to create a personalized schedule and work from the comfort of home. Notably, this franchise does not have high upfront fees, royalties, or territorial restrictions, offering moms a streamlined pathway to success. If you’re a mom with a passion for education and a desire to make a positive impact on young learners, Tutoring Works offers an accessible and fulfilling franchise opportunity tailored to your expertise and values.


Dog Training Elite, America’s fastest-growing dog training franchise, boasts over 40 years of experience. Their unique approach strengthens the bond between dogs and their handlers, delivered directly to customers’ homes. With minimal initial investment and high returns, they offer a flexible, home-based franchise opportunity ideal for stay-at-home moms.


This mom franchise is an ideal choice due to its low barriers to entry, no prior dog training experience needed, and impressive profit margins. As a home-based franchise, it allows moms to balance work and family while making a meaningful impact. For moms with a passion for dogs and a customer-service-oriented mindset, Dog Training Elite is an excellent opportunity to succeed in the dog training business.


Rolling Suds, with over 30 years of industry experience, offers a home-based opportunity in the exterior cleaning business. Founded in Warrington, PA, Rolling Suds has served over 100,000 residential and commercial customers, earning a stellar reputation for its commitment to excellence. Specializing in power and soft washing for homes and businesses, Rolling Suds simplifies power washing for customers.


For stay-at-home moms with an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for cleanliness, Rolling Suds offers a fulfilling pathway to business ownership in the power washing industry. This opportunity stands out as one of the best franchises for moms thanks to its unique blend of flexibility, allowing you to manage your schedule, and scalability, enabling expansion into additional markets as your business grows. With Rolling Suds, all moms need to do is follow their proven business model, and they’ll be serving their community in as little as 60 days.


ClaimTek Systems, with 25 years of industry expertise, is a recognized name in medical and dental billing, software, and business development. The increasing trend of small healthcare practices turning to outsourced billing services ensures steady demand in this industry. While prior experience is not a prerequisite, it may be an especially appealing mom franchise to those with a background in the medical field.


For stay-at-home moms exploring entrepreneurial ventures, ClaimTek Systems offers a profitable option. It provides flexibility and training and requires no healthcare experience. ClaimTek’s low-overhead model promises attractive profit margins, making it a viable choice for those venturing into their own business in the medical billing field.


Fresh Coat stands as North America’s leading high-volume interior painting company. With a turn-key business model that boasts high profit margins and minimal startup costs, Fresh Coat provides the perfect platform for “mompreneurs” looking to be their own boss. Their comprehensive range of services, including interior and exterior painting, wallpaper removal, pressure washing, and more, caters to both residential and commercial clients. Fresh Coat not only offers lead generation support through digital marketing efforts and national alliances but also provides exclusive discounts from renowned paint suppliers like Sherwin Williams.


This mom franchise opportunity aligns seamlessly with the goals and lifestyles of stay-at-home moms seeking income. It’s an accessible and lucrative option, with no prior painting experience necessary. With a focus on work-life balance, low operating costs, and higher profit potential, Fresh Coat provides an attractive pathway for moms to embark on their self-employment journey.


In today’s fast-paced world, stay-at-home moms are embracing the exciting opportunities that franchising offers to create the perfect balance between family life and business ownership. We’ve explored an array of franchise options tailored to the skills and aspirations of moms, but what makes these opportunities truly special is their compatibility with the supermom lifestyle.


P3 Cost Analysts stands out as a supreme choice for business-savvy moms. With over 30 years of expertise in cost reduction, P3 empowers you to make a significant financial impact on businesses without the need for auditing experience. Our model harmonizes perfectly with the supermom lifestyle, offering the freedom to work from home, design your schedule, and create a thriving venture while nurturing your family and tapping into uncapped earnings. By choosing P3, you’re not just entering the world of franchising; you’re joining a network that values your unique abilities and provides the training and support you need to thrive.


So why wait? Call us today at 1-877-843-7579 or reach out to speak with our franchise experts so that we can help you get started.

Andrew Salmon is the Chief Future Officer at SALMON Health and Retirement, a senior living and healthcare facility that addresses older adults at different stages of their lives. In his role, Andrew has scaled the company by sourcing the acquisition of SALMON VNA & Hospice. Additionally, he has forged numerous exclusive and preferred vendor relationships with partners that have helped the company grow sustainably. Andrew is an experienced healthcare service professional skilled in nonprofit organizations, event planning, customer service, coaching, and Medicaid. He is a father and a world-class athlete who has completed six Ironman Triathlons and competed in two world championships in 2008 and 2012. 


According to a study conducted by The Conway Center for Family Business, only 12% of all family businesses are operational by the third generation. So, how can family businesses succeed amid industry shifts in today’s volatile marketplace? 


As a third generation business owner of a senior healthcare and living facility, Andrew Salmon strives to be the premier provider of senior healthcare and housing in New England. To accomplish this goal, he has acquired a hospice and intimate care center that promotes independence and comfortable living through innovative technology catered to residents’ needs, yoga and fitness classes, and memory care. When facing challenges and competition in the market, Andrew recommends focusing on the aspects of your business you can control to adapt effectively to industry changes. 


On this episode of The Enterprise Builders Podcast, Scott Swearingen welcomes Andrew Salmon, the Chief Future Officer at SALMON Health and Retirement, to discuss how to succeed as a family business in the senior healthcare and housing industry. Andrew shares three takeaways from previous generations of his family business, how SALMON provides high-quality care and services for their clients, and the challenges the business faced and how they overcame them.


This episode is brought to you by P3 Cost Analysts.

With a team of the industry’s leading utility, telecom, waste and recycling, and property tax auditors in the nation, we have saved our clients over $300 million. 


Our experienced auditors have helped thousands of clients save hundreds of thousands of dollars, from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies.

Starting a franchise is a great option for women looking to maintain a work-life balance while fulfilling their dream of running a business. In fact, the number of female franchise owners has nearly doubled over the past decade, and more than a third of franchise owners are now women.


This rise in female-led franchising aligns with a broader shift towards empowering women entrepreneurs in all fields. Women are increasingly seeking opportunities that not only align with their professional goals but also accommodate their personal and family commitments.


In this article, we’ll explore the diverse range of franchise opportunities particularly suited for women. We’ll examine key factors such as location flexibility, comprehensive franchisee support, upfront costs, and promising market opportunities. These elements are vital in identifying franchises that not only promise success but also align with the unique needs and aspirations of women entrepreneurs today.


Let’s explore these criteria further and discover some of the most rewarding and viable franchise opportunities for women in 2024.


There are a few big things we considered when coming up with our short list of best franchises for women to own, including location flexibility, franchisee support, upfront costs, and market opportunity. Let’s take a look at each of these below.


Being able to run a franchise from home or from a location close to home is appealing to women for a variety of reasons. Some want this flexibility in order to spend more time with their children, while others simply prefer the convenience of not having to commute to work.


Whatever your preferences are when it comes to choosing a location, there are many franchises to choose from that will support the lifestyle you want to create.


Franchise support is a crucial aspect of opening a franchise that must be considered, especially if you have minimal experience within a certain industry. With the right franchise, you can go from beginner to expert franchisee in a short amount of time.


All great franchises will provide support in these key areas:


Some franchises will require more capital to start than others, but there are many low-cost franchises that are suitable for women trying to stay within a budget. Many franchises also offer financing options which can be useful as you start out on your journey.


Before starting a franchise, it’s important to research the competition and size of the market you want to enter. If you choose to start a franchise that operates remotely, you’ll likely have a larger population of people you can work with versus a franchise that only can serve local customers. It’s also important to pick an industry that’s poised to see growth.


As a franchisee with P3 Cost Analysts, you’ll have the opportunity to help businesses reduce operational costs and avoid being overcharged by the vendors they work with. Cost-reduction consulting is a growing field and businesses everywhere are noticing the benefits of working with a company like P3 Cost Analysts.


P3 Cost Analysts offers top-notch support to all of their franchisees which includes access to industry expertise, extensive training, and the best tools available to run your business. The ongoing support from P3 Cost Analysts is also invaluable for franchisees looking to truly excel in this field.


By starting a Visiting Angels franchise, you’ll be able to capitalize on the growing senior home care market. As a franchisee, you’ll have the opportunity to manage a team of home care workers while also being able to serve the senior population in your community.


Those who start a Visiting Angels franchise find the work to be rewarding and truly feel like they’re making a difference in the lives of our seniors. No previous experience is required, but empathy for seniors and their challenges is a crucial skill to find success in this industry.


If keeping commercial offices clean and germ-free interests you, then starting a 360clean is a great fit. As a franchisee, you’ll manage a team of cleaners and form relationships with the companies that use the 360clean service.


360clean goes the extra mile when it comes to cleanliness, using top-of-the-line products and strategies to help offices look their best and reduce the spread of germs and illnesses.


360clean is a great turnkey opportunity and their centralized marketing system aids their franchisees in establishing a consistent pipeline of customers.


If you have an eye and passion for interior design, starting a franchise with Decorating Den is a great option. As the world’s largest interior design franchisor, Decorating Den offers its franchisees access to their network of suppliers, training support, marketing systems, management systems, and proprietary business software.


Though previous experience isn’t required, an ideal candidate will need the ability to understand design trends and also have interpersonal communication skills.


Opening a Cruise Planners franchise is a great opportunity for women that are travel enthusiasts who also want to work from a home office.


As the nation’s largest travel advisor network, Cruise Planners gives its franchisees access to world-class technology solutions, marketing resources, and professional coaching.


Franchisees are also given access to travel discounts so they can explore exciting new destinations with their families.


As a Fit4Mom franchisee, you’ll have the opportunity to offer prenatal and postnatal fitness programs to mothers. Fit4Mom offers extensive franchisee training including general certification courses and specialized training based on the programs you want to offer your clients. Some franchisees decide to simply manage other instructors while others take a hybrid approach and also teach classes themselves.


If you enjoy supporting mothers along their fitness journeys and building a network of like-minded mothers, this will be a great fit.


Starting an Apricot Lane Boutique franchise is a great opportunity for women looking to showcase and sell handpicked accessories, apparel, and other gifts. As an owner, you’ll tailor a physical store to your local community and sell unique goods that customers will love.


Along with every brick-and-mortar location comes an e-commerce store so that you can expand your reach and demographic. In today’s age, this hybrid approach is a must to reach your potential market.


Apricot Lane offers great support and empowers women every step of their journey. From in-home training to market buying trips, Apricot Lane goes the extra mile to make sure their franchisees succeed.


For women passionate about pets, Hounds Town USA represents an exceptional opportunity. Founded by a seasoned K-9 handler, this franchise specializes in doggie daycare, overnight boarding, and grooming, all grounded in authentic dog psychology.


This doggy daycare business offers women a fulfilling career, financial potential, and operational simplicity. Hounds Town USA is a perfect match for female entrepreneurs seeking to combine their love for dogs with a thriving business, making it one of the best franchises for women.


Astrawatt Solar emerges as one of the top franchises for women, especially those interested in the renewable energy sector. Astrawatt Solar offers a unique opportunity for women to join this thriving field during the solar industry’s “Green Gold Rush.”


This franchise, known for its rapid growth, caters to both seasoned solar industry professionals and those new to the field, making it one of the best franchises for women looking to make a mark in renewable energy. With comprehensive training and support, Astrawatt Solar provides an ideal platform for women seeking franchise opportunities in a high-growth, sustainable industry.


The Tutoring Center stands out as an ideal franchise for women with a passion for education and child development. They offer a unique one-to-one instruction style combined with The Rotational Approach to Learning, which is highly effective for children with various learning needs, including those with ADD and ADHD.


As a franchisee, you’ll recruit top-notch instructors, ensuring your center provides the best tutoring in the industry. This franchise represents a perfect opportunity for women looking to make a meaningful impact in their community while owning a rewarding and financially viable business.


Images 4 Kids represents one of the top franchises for women, especially for those looking to balance a passion for photography with family life. This franchise is an excellent opportunity for stay-at-home moms and female entrepreneurs, providing a platform to explore creativity while capturing the precious moments of preschool children.


With no previous photography experience required, it’s a great opportunity for women seeking a career change or a fulfilling entrepreneurial venture. The franchise offers flexible scheduling and has a lower buy-in, making it a perfect fit for women seeking low-cost franchise opportunities for women. Images 4 Kids provides comprehensive training, ensuring even novices can excel in this rewarding field.


Breadsmith offers fulfilling franchise opportunities for women with a passion for baking and community engagement. Known for award-winning, fresh, artisan breads, Breadsmith franchises supply multiple revenue streams, including retail and wholesale sales.


As a franchisee, you will receive extensive training in artisan baking and business operations, alongside site selection assistance and over 300 hours of support for your store opening. Breadsmith’s presence in major US markets and its customizable product selection make it an attractive venture for those looking to serve their local community with quality baked goods. With nearly three decades of franchising, Breadsmith is a proven path to owning a successful bakery business.


As we’ve seen, there are many great low-cost franchises for women to start. Before committing to any opportunity though, we suggest that you do some research and decide which industry will suit you best.


As the number of female franchise owners continues to rise, now is your chance to start a business that aligns with your lifestyle and brings you a sense of accomplishment. For many women who come from a business background, starting a cost reduction consulting franchise is a popular option.


They get to help businesses of all sizes while being able to apply their previous experience. Additionally, this field is poised for growth and offers much profit potential for women everywhere.


If starting a cost reduction consulting franchise sounds like a good fit for you, visit our franchising page to learn more about this unique opportunity.


Helping over 30,000 client locations save money on their monthly expenses since 1991.


P3 Cost Analysts is proud to be a fully remote working organization since 2021. 100% of P3 employees work remotely.


© 2022 P3 Cost Analysts, All rights reserved.


If you’re not already an experienced business owner, all the technical jargon may be confusing when you start evaluating potential franchise opportunities. Understanding the nuances between revenue and profit, net worth and liquid capital, or minimum cash and startup costs may not come naturally to those who don’t have a business degree. That doesn’t mean you won’t make a good franchisee. It just means you need to do a little legwork first.


In this article, we’re going to take a closer look at one of the key components in determining if a franchise opportunity will work for you – liquid capital. Understanding the concept of liquid capital, how much you need, and how to get it for your franchise is crucial to start your entrepreneurial journey. So, let’s dive into the details!


Liquid capital, often referred to as liquid assets, is any asset that can be quickly and easily converted into cash without losing its value. In regards to opening a franchise, liquid capital is essentially your ready-to-use funds that can be utilized immediately for any necessary expenses.


So, what does liquid capital mean for potential franchisees? It’s easy to confuse liquid capital with the amount due to the franchisor. While the total liquid capital required for a franchisee certainly encompasses costs to cover the franchise fee, it also extends to other startup expenses necessary to kickstart the business. These costs may include rent or real estate, training, inventory, and additional overheads.


Another common misconception among franchisees is thinking that liquid capital and net worth are the same thing. Net worth is the cumulative total of both liquid (easily convertible to cash) and illiquid assets (assets that are not readily convertible to cash). In contrast, liquid capital, as highlighted in the examples below, includes only those assets that can be swiftly converted into cash.


Understanding the difference between liquid capital and net worth is crucial when planning your franchise investment. More importantly, it helps you guarantee that you can meet the minimum liquid capital requirements of the franchise opportunity you’re interested in.


When it comes to acquiring a franchise, potential franchisees should be aware of various sources of liquid capital at their disposal. Let’s look at some of the most common examples.


At the top of the list of liquid capital examples is cash or the balance you have in your savings account. This cash can be quickly and easily used for any immediate business needs.


Stocks, bonds, and other marketable securities also qualify as liquid capital. Their value lies in their marketability – they can be sold on the stock exchange, providing a quick influx of cash when required. However, it’s important to remember that the selling price is dependent on the market conditions at the time of sale.


Mutual funds, essentially pools of diversified investments, constitute another form of liquid capital. Despite the complexity of these investments, they can typically be sold within a few business days, transforming into cash at hand.


Similar to mutual funds, money market funds are a type of investment fund. They are considered highly liquid due to their short-term nature. This allows for quick conversion to cash, further adding to your liquid capital.


While understanding what counts as liquid capital is integral to your franchise investment journey, it’s equally important to recognize non-liquid assets. Non-liquid capital refers to assets that cannot be quickly converted into cash without potentially losing value. Here are some common examples:


Properties, whether residential or commercial, fall under the category of non-liquid capital. Despite their considerable value, they can’t be quickly or easily sold without the risk of a price drop. Real estate transactions can take weeks or even months to complete, which doesn’t offer the immediate accessibility that liquid capital does.


Items like art, antiques, rare coins, or other collectibles are also considered non-liquid capital. While they may hold value, finding a buyer willing to pay that value can be a time-consuming process, making them a less optimal source of capital.


Machinery, vehicles, or other equipment related to your business or personal use are also forms of non-liquid capital. Although these assets might be highly valuable, selling them for their true worth could be challenging and time-consuming, hence their classification as non-liquid.


For individuals below retirement age, retirement accounts generally fall under non-liquid assets. Despite their substantial value, accessing these funds early can invite penalties and tax implications, making them less ideal as a source of liquid capital for a franchise investment.


Potential investors often focus on the initial franchise fee when considering buying a franchise. However, the financial aspect of owning a franchise extends far beyond this initial payment. Franchises generally set a minimum liquid capital requirement for potential franchisees. This ensures that they possess the requisite financial backing, not just for the initial purchase but also to sustain the franchise until it becomes profitable.


The term “liquid capital” might vary in definition across franchises. Some may have a more expansive interpretation of what assets count as liquid, while others might be more restrictive. It’s essential to thoroughly understand and align with the specific definitions set by the franchise you’re considering by reading over the Franchise Disclosure Document.


Beyond the initial investment, franchises come with various startup costs, from leasing space and acquiring inventory to training staff and launching marketing initiatives. Furthermore, achieving profitability in a new business doesn’t happen overnight. There might be a period where expenses surpass revenue, especially in the initial stages. During such times, liquid capital acts as a financial safety net, ensuring the business can continue its operations uninterrupted. It provides the franchisee with a buffer to navigate early challenges, making it a crucial aspect of the franchising journey.


In general, most franchises will have a minimum requirement of $50,000 in liquid assets. However, some demand much more. For instance, the P3 Cost Analysts franchise has a relatively low cash minimum of $59,500. Meanwhile, other franchise opportunities will differ. KFC, for example, requires potential franchisees to have $750,000 in liquid assets.


However, it’s essential to ensure that diving into a franchise doesn’t put you in a bad spot financially. Maintaining a cushion for personal expenses and unforeseen business challenges is crucial. Though thorough research and due diligence can help in selecting a promising franchise, there’s an inherent risk in starting a business. Therefore, it’s wise to ensure you have enough liquid capital in reserve to pay personal bills and expenses during the initial phases when profitability might not be immediate.


Whether you are planning to buy a franchise or are just starting your research, you might be wondering, “How do you get liquid capital for a franchise?” If your money isn’t easily accessible in your savings accounts, you may have convertible assets that can add to your total available. Here are a few options to consider:


This is the most straightforward way to accumulate liquid capital. By saving a portion of your income over time, you can build up your liquid capital reserves without borrowing or selling assets.


If you have personal assets such as valuable collectibles or equipment, you could sell these to generate liquid capital. However, this should be done with caution as it could have tax implications and also reduce your net worth.


Tapping into your home’s equity through a HELOC can provide ready funds. As you repay your mortgage and your property’s value increases, you accumulate equity, which can be borrowed against for liquid capital. This option often has lower interest rates than other loans, but remember, your home serves as the collateral. If you can’t pay back the loan, you risk losing your property.


In some cases, you might have family members or friends willing to invest in your franchise business. However, this option should be approached carefully to avoid any future disagreements or strained relationships.


How does liquid capital work?


Liquid capital refers to assets that can be quickly and easily converted into cash without significant loss in value. In the context of business, it represents readily available funds that can be used to cover immediate and short-term needs, such as payroll, rent, and inventory.


How do you get liquid capital for a franchise?


Two common ways to gather liquid capital for a franchise include tapping into personal savings or selling personal assets, such as stocks, collectibles, or valuable equipment.


Is a 401k considered liquid capital?


While a 401k holds value and can be accessed, it’s not typically classified as liquid capital because withdrawing funds early can result in penalties and tax consequences. However, using strategies like Rollover for Business Startups (ROBS), individuals can tap into their 401k to finance a franchise without penalties.


Is a loan considered liquid capital?


Some franchisors do not regard borrowed money as liquid capital. This is because loans come with the obligation of repayment, which can impact the financial stability of the franchisee.


Is a house a liquid asset?


Generally, a house is a non-liquid asset. Selling it to convert it into cash can be time-consuming and depends on current market conditions.


How to get liquid capital for a franchise?


Acquiring liquid assets can be done by building up personal savings over time or by selling personal assets like stocks or collectibles.


Choosing franchises with minimal buy-in requirements, such as P3 Cost Analysts, can ease financial pressures. With reasonable franchise costs, startup expenses, and overheads, it’s a financially accessible venture that still allows for a healthy ROI.


Yet, low startup costs do not imply a lack of support. At P3, affordability and support go hand in hand. Each franchisee is equipped with comprehensive tools, training, and resources to ensure their success. The balance of low initial investment and a robust backing system positions P3 Cost Analysts as a high-value, low-barrier entry into the world of franchising.


Navigating the world of franchising can be complex, but understanding your financial footing is crucial. Liquid capital plays an essential role in determining your readiness and capability to dive into franchise ownership. By comprehending what constitutes liquid capital, its importance, and ways to acquire it, you’re better positioned to make informed decisions.


For those seeking a low-barrier entry with substantial support, franchises like P3 Cost Analysts present a promising avenue to explore. If you’re ready to take the first step, contact us today by filling out the form on our franchising page.


Helping over 30,000 client locations save money on their monthly expenses since 1991.


P3 Cost Analysts is proud to be a fully remote working organization since 2021. 100% of P3 employees work remotely.

Starting a franchise is a great way to live out your dream of business ownership. Though some franchises might be out of your current budget, there are many great options that you can get up and running for under 100k. There are many types of franchises to choose from, and depending on your skills and interests, there is likely a franchise that will fit you best.


This article dives into the world of affordable franchise opportunities. Discover what makes a franchise great and explore our handpicked selection of top franchises under 100K for you to launch this year.


Starting a franchise under 100k presents a unique opportunity for aspiring entrepreneurs. With a lower financial entry barrier, these options offer a pathway to business ownership without the need for substantial upfront capital or excessive debt. This affordability not only reduces financial risk but also accelerates the potential for a quicker return on investment.


Despite their lower cost, these franchises come with a proven business model that potential franchise owners are looking for. Franchises for 100K or less still have established track records of success and offer valuable support and training to ensure franchisees thrive. This means you can step into a business with a tested blueprint, benefiting from the experience and expertise of the franchisor, without the need for a massive investment. It’s a practical choice that combines affordability with the benefit of a strong foundation.


By following the criteria below, you’ll be well on your way to finding a franchise that will support you along your journey and set you up for success.


Some franchises will require you to operate from a brick-and-mortar location while others are able to function completely from home. Which option you choose largely depends on your lifestyle and preference when it comes to location.


Any respected franchise will provide the resources and tools you need to find success with the franchise.


The franchise you choose should support you in the following ways:


It should be obvious that there needs to be a demand for the franchise you are opening. Do some research and figure out what franchise(s) your community would benefit from now, and into the future.


Starting a franchise with P3 Cost Analysts gives you the opportunity to help businesses reduce spending in a variety of different cost categories including utilities, telecom, merchant processing, copier/print, property tax, waste management, and uniform and linen expenses. With a team of experts behind you, you’ll learn the ins and outs of cutting costs for businesses of all types and sizes.


P3 Costs Analysts provide world-class support to their franchisees through extensive training, access to top-notch tools, and even coaching. If helping businesses everywhere positively impact their bottom line through cost reduction excites you, starting a franchise with P3 Cost Analysts is a great fit.


The health services sector is a growing industry and you can be part of this growth by starting a franchise with American Business Systems. With over 25 years in the field, American Business Systems has built a model where franchisees can find success even if they don’t have any prior medical or billing experience.


With an extensive toolbox for revenue cycle management, practice management, and other necessary solutions, you can feel confident in starting your business. Also, if you feel like this franchise isn’t a good fit, you can get 100% of your money back within the first 30 days.


If you’re a travel junkie who also desires to work from anywhere, starting a Cruise Planners franchise is a great opportunity. By starting a franchise with the largest travel advisor network in the nation, you’ll have access to the technology solutions, marketing resources, and professional guidance you need to run a successful business. Furthermore, you are also granted access to travel discounts, so you, too, can continue exploring the world.


If you want to help businesses keep their offices and other buildings clean and hygienic, you might want to consider starting a 360clean franchise. It will be your job to manage a team of cleaners and find businesses that could utilize the 360clean service. You’ll have access to top-of-the-line cleaning products and techniques to keep your clients happy, healthy, and willing to recommend your service.


As a great turnkey opportunity, you’ll get to leverage 360clean’s centralized marketing system in order to have a steady stream of clients day in and day out.


If you’re interested in sustainable and environmentally friendly lawn care, then starting a Weed Man franchise could be the franchise for you. As an award-winning lawn care franchise, Weed Man has a proven business model to help you secure clients and grow your business.


Some of the perks of starting a Weed Man franchise include gaining exclusive rights to the territories you operate in, comprehensive training, access to state-of-the-art management tools and marketing systems, and guidance from industry experts. There is also much room for growth in this industry, and recurring revenues are common within this franchise.


If you’re looking to make a difference in the lives of students ranging from kindergarten through college, starting a Tutor Doctor franchise will be a good fit. As a franchise, you’ll manage a team of tutors from a variety of disciplines that will offer in-home or remote tutoring services. This industry is recession-resistant and is poised for growth over the upcoming years.


Furthermore, you don’t have to come from an educational background to start a Tutor Doctor franchise. With the support and training provided by Tutor Doctor, you will have everything you need to start your franchise and begin changing the lives of students all across the world.


If helping people get healthier and in shape is a passion of yours, then starting a GYMGUYZ franchise could be a good fit. GYMGUYZ specializes in in-home personal training for yourself, your family, or a group of your choosing. They host workshops and classes in the location of your choice and on your time.


As a franchisee, you’ll manage territory and a team of fitness experts that all can teach different kinds of classes. You also have access to top-of-the-line fitness equipment for your team to use. GYMGUYZ has great support for the franchisees and provides all the resources you’ll need to be profitable in this endeavor.


The in-home senior care market is on the rise with no sign of stopping. When you start a franchise with Visiting Angels, you will be able to capture a portion of this market and set yourself up for long-term growth. You’ll get to manage a team of caring and compassionate home care workers while knowing that the seniors in your community are getting the best possible care.


Since this is purpose-driven work, franchisees often feel a sense of accomplishment and know that they are making a difference for the elderly. Visiting Angels also provides extensive training and support to ensure the success of their franchisees. Furthermore, you don’t need prior experience in senior care, but you do need essential soft skills such as empathy, patience, and strong communication.


The pet industry is thriving in the United States, with a staggering 85 million pet households with 95% of pet owners considering their beloved companions a part of the family. In 2022 alone, $137 billion was spent within the pet industry. Woof Gang Bakery & Grooming, a pet services franchise under 100K, sees annual sales reaching $703K and yearly profits hitting $100K, allowing you to get a slice of the pie.


With the franchise already spanning more than 280 locations across 25 states, Woof Gang has proven to be a top-tier grooming experience and unique retail venture. Aspiring entrepreneurs looking to combine their passion for pets with their desire to own their own businesses will receive comprehensive support, including assistance with site selection, lease negotiation, store design and construction, vendor sourcing, staffing support, and employee training from the franchisor.


With increasingly busy lifestyles, homeowners are seeking reliable and efficient cleaning solutions. In this thriving industry, home cleaning franchises have found their niche by providing convenience, cleanliness, and peace of mind to clients who want to maintain a tidy and organized living space.


Molly Maid offers a unique opportunity in this niche, delivering work-life balance with family-friendly hours, ongoing training and support, and a reputation for excellence that attracts repeat customers. With a scalable model and a track record of long-term success, Molly Maid stands out as a top franchise for those seeking success with a franchise for under 100K.


In the massive $84 billion beauty industry, looking and feeling beautiful has become more accessible than ever. One of the latest trends in beauty regimens for women worldwide is semi-permanent eyelash extensions. Amazing Lash Studio has emerged as a trailblazer in this beauty category, offering various unique styles that cater to diverse preferences.


For those seeking franchises for 100k, Amazing Lash Studio has secured its spot as a leader in the beauty industry with over 220 successful locations. What sets Amazing Lash Studio apart is its ability to deliver recurring revenue through memberships and a spa-like setting. The brand’s Lash Stylist training program ensures high standards of quality, making it a compelling choice for entrepreneurs looking to invest in a thriving beauty franchise. Despite its impressive reach, there are still many markets available.


With consumers increasingly seeking healthier and more convenient dining options, the fast-casual industry has witnessed a surge in demand for nutritious meals. Nautical Bowls addresses this trend by offering açai bowls brimming with superfoods, essential nutrients, and organic ingredients — all prepared in under two minutes.


Entrepreneurs looking for an affordable and profitable franchise opportunity will appreciate Nautical Bowls. While restaurants typically require higher investments, Nautical Bowls offers a remarkable opportunity with an initial down payment of $100k. The franchise boasts streamlined operations, efficient real estate options, and minimal staffing requirements, making it an accessible venture. This unique franchise for 100K allows you to enter a thriving industry for less than the industry average.


As we’ve seen, there are many great franchises under 100k you can start this year. Before committing to any opportunity though, we suggest that you do some research and decide which industry will suit you best.


As the number of franchise owners continues to rise, now is your chance to start a business that aligns with your lifestyle and brings you a sense of accomplishment. For many franchisees who come from a business background, starting a cost reduction consulting franchise is a popular option.


They get to help businesses of all sizes while being able to apply their previous experience. Additionally, this field is poised for growth and offers much profit potential for people everywhere.


If starting a cost reduction consulting franchise sounds like a good fit for you, visit our franchising page to learn more about this unique opportunity.

Kirk Williamson is a Franchisee at P3 Cost Analysts, an expense reduction consulting franchise specializing in reducing businesses’ telecom, waste, and utility bills. After college, he worked for a department store before working as a banker. Before P3, Kirk worked in the oil and gas industry for four years and later joined the investment industry as a stockbroker, where he worked for 38 years. 


Owning a business in the financial industry can be challenging. So, what does it take to thrive as an entrepreneur in this space?


With a mission to satisfy his desire to own a business, Kirk Williamson acquired a franchise company in the cost-reduction industry. He has faced many challenges in acquiring clients, maintaining relationships, initiating transactions, and generating strategic growth. Kirk advises other entrepreneurs not to seek motivation by setting and achieving goals. Instead, he maintains the importance of possessing keen determination to obtain partnerships on a consistent basis so you can scale your business. 


On this episode of The Enterprise Builders Podcast, Aaron Stahl welcomes Kirk Williamson, a Franchisee at P3 Cost Analysts, to discuss how to become a successful entrepreneur. Kirk shares his personal and professional background and the inspiration to become an entrepreneur, tips for owning a successful business, the challenges of starting a business from scratch, and advice for future entrepreneurs.


This episode is brought to you by P3 Cost Analysts.

Our experienced auditors have helped thousands of clients save hundreds of thousands of dollars, from small businesses to Fortune 500 companies.

Kirk McJunkin is a Business Owner at P3 Cost Analysts, an expense reduction consulting franchise specializing in reducing businesses’ telecom, waste, and utility bills. After graduating from The University of Texas at Austin with a degree in business administration and finance, Kirk was drafted as an offensive lineman for the Pittsburgh Steelers.  Before P3, he was the Executive Athletic Director at Trinity Christian Academy, the Director of Business Development at Oldcastle, and the Vice President of JE Dunn Construction. 


Are you trying to start a business? Have you considered owning a franchise? What does it take to manage a franchise company successfully? 


After being employed and managing his dad’s business for some time, Kirk McJunkin was still unsatisfied with his occupations. In search of financial and personal freedom, he decided to acquire a franchise business in the cost-reduction space. After overcoming challenges faced in transactions, partnerships, and strategic growth, Kirk advises others to start off collaborating with small, private businesses to gain skills and expertise. 


On this episode of The Enterprise Builders Podcast, Aaron Stahl welcomes Kirk McJunkin, a Business Owner at P3 Cost Analysts, to discuss his journey to becoming a successful franchisee. Kirk shares his background and the inspiration to become an entrepreneur, the importance of having clarity and accountability in company roles, the challenges faced and lessons he learned starting a business in the cost-reduction space, and his advice for up-and-coming entrepreneurs.

© 2022 P3 Cost Analysts, All rights reserved.




Contracts are a necessary part of running a business. Different companies must have clear expectations and hold each other accountable in order for everyone’s operations to run smoothly. However, these contractual agreements can be one-sided, making it hard for the smaller player to stand up for themselves.


Waste management companies are notorious for these unfair contracts, and Republic Services is no exception. There are many people out there trying to cancel Republic Services, only to be met with a complicated process or no response from their representatives. If this is you, keep reading to get a better understanding of the Republic Services cancellation process and figure out how to get the help you need.


Republic Services is a prominent waste management company that provides a comprehensive range of waste collection and disposal services. Claiming a commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship, Republic Services focuses on managing waste responsibly while offering efficient and reliable solutions. The company serves millions of residential, commercial, industrial, and municipal customers across the United States.


Republic Services offers various waste management services tailored to meet diverse needs. Their residential services encompass curbside waste collection, recycling programs, and yard waste removal. For businesses, Republic Services provides customized waste and recycling solutions, including commercial dumpster rentals, compactor services, and comprehensive waste management plans.


Many people find themselves or their business in an undesirable contract with Republic Services. Often, these contracts have favorable terms for Republic Services, while the other party gets the short end of the stick.


If you’re considering entering into an agreement with Republic Services, you should consider the following things:


Additional fees popping up on your invoice are not unique to Republic Services. The entire waste management industry is known for having billing errors and overcharges on their invoices. Republic Services outlines the fees that may appear on their invoices in the contract for invoice-to-invoice agreements. These include:


Not only should you expect your contract to include clauses for many different types of fees, but Republic Services is also known to include rate increases for services that may or may not be lawful. The waste management company has been on the receiving end of various lawsuits due to unlawful rate increases and fuel recovery fees, according to the website Republic Services Exposed. Knowing that Republic has already had issues with unlawful rate increases may cause business owners to seek Republic Services’ contract termination methods.


The same website also reports that Republic Services has been forced to refund millions of dollars to their customers due to unauthorized fees and overcharges. Customers are responsible for finding these errors and invoices and submitting a claim for a refund. Most business owners don’t have time to dedicate to this process and therefore end up overspending on trash collection. Companies like P3 Cost Analysts can help businesses immensely by handling invoice audits for them or helping them cancel Republic Services.


In addition to employing questionable contract tactics, Republic Services lacks transparency and standard pricing. Some sales representatives prioritize commissions by encouraging customers to pay more for services, and business owners can’t trust that their representatives have their best interests at heart.


If you go to the customer support portion of their website, the Republic Services Cancellation Policy looks pretty straightforward. Just give them a call and speak to your representative. In reality, many customers have a very hard time getting a hold of anyone to speak to at all.


To guarantee the best success rate, we recommend working with a professional waste management auditor like P3 Cost Analysts, as there are numerous roadblocks not covered here Republic could put in your way. If you would like to go it alone, the following steps can serve as a guide for you.


You should have read the fine print of your contract, like the terms and conditions, before signing. But if it’s been a while, or you didn’t pay close enough attention, you should go back to your contract before reaching out to your representative. Find out the specific cancellation requirements as outlined in your contract so you enter the conversation with all the necessary information and don’t experience any surprises.


The next step is to call Republic Services. According to their website, you can find a phone number for your representative on the front of your invoice. Another option is to call their customer support line. Before calling, gather all the necessary account information to make the process smoother. Some customers may also have the option to cancel through the customer portal.


It’s important to note that the Republic Services Cancellation Policy states that advance notice is required to cancel their services. Oftentimes it will not go into effect until 30 days after they receive cancellation.


If you’re able to get a hold of your Republic Services representative or a customer support agent, clearly state that your intention is to cancel their services. Waste management companies often make it difficult for their customers to get out of the contract, so they may try to convince you to stay with them. It would be a good idea to document the time, date, and name of the representative you’re speaking with in case you run into problems down the line. It’s highly likely they will reference the contract or refer to the fact you are in an auto-renewal period at this time.


If the representative you speak with gives you any further instructions on how to finish the Republic Services contract termination process, make sure you complete each step. This may include instructions on what to do with any equipment of theirs or official forms you need to fill out.


There have been reports of people requesting cancellation but continuing to be charged by Republic Services. Request a confirmation of the cancellation in writing just in case they continue to charge you after your requested cancellation date. Be sure to check for future invoices and keep an eye out for any refunds you’re expecting.


If you’re struggling with these steps on your own, save yourself the frustration. Companies like P3 Cost Analysts have decades of experience going up against giant waste-hauling companies like Republic Services. We can help you figure out how to cancel Republic Services, as well as help you find a better waste-hauling company and monitor future invoices for errors and overcharges from your next provider.


With so many customers having issues with Republic Services and other heavy hitters such as Waste Management, some have started to look for smaller, more local waste-hauling companies that may provide a better customer experience. These organizations are also likely to be more flexible during contract negotiations.


In many cases, Republic may be your best option. But in some cases you have choices. If you want Republic Services to stop service to your home or business, you’ll need to find another waste hauler to replace them.


The first step is to cancel Republic Services; then you can begin shopping around for new providers. However, it’s important not to get locked into another predatory contract. P3 Cost Analysts can step in here to help you negotiate an agreement that serves you.


There is no shortage of disappointed customers working with Republic Services, just like most of the other major waste-hauling providers. Unfortunately, these contracts are often written in favor of the supplier, leaving businesses and residences stuck with no way out.


Republic Services makes it appear that the Republic Services Stop Service Process is straightforward and simple. Just follow the steps – look at your contract, contact your representative, and request a cancellation. Unfortunately, many people don’t have such a simple experience.


If you’re looking for help at any stage of the waste management contract process, contact P3 Cost Analysts’ waste auditors. We will help you with the Republic Services cancellation process, as well as auditing your invoices, ensuring the cost-effectiveness of your contracts, and catching overcharges.


To get your waste management expenses under control, schedule a free expense audit with P3 today!

Steve has owned 3 business’s in the past, and spend the majority of his career in the Office Technology industry. He has been involved with several acquisitions, and startups, and enjoys the challenge of building a successful business. The last 3 years he has been consulting, and has recently become a P3 Franchisee.


He enjoys family, and has 4 children, 10 grandchildren, and 1 greatgrandchild. Family gatherings are a joy, and spending time playing sports and games with the family are a part of every gathering.


Steve is an active pilot, land enjoys flying various aircraft, including antiques, classics and WW-2 training aircraft. He tries to attend the EAA Air Adventure at Oshkosh each year, (along with 600,000 other people). He enjoys all sports, and still plays competitive Basketball a couple of times a week.


Steve and His wife Judy enjoy travel, especially to the Caribbean. They have been to many places, but enjoy Jamaica, and try to meet up friends there a couple of times a year.


 


At P3 Cost Analysts, we've worked with over 30,000 client l0cations around the country since 1991.  Over the past 30+ years we've created a proprietary nationwide database of vendor benchmarks.  We leverage this data, and the industry expertise of our leading category experts, to drive savings for our clients.  We find savings at 9 out of every 10 clients we work with.
